Title:
WRKY Transcription Factors and a Future in Specialized
Metabolism
Keywords:
secondary metabolism, specialized metabolism, WRKY,
transcription factor
Abstract:
This year marks the 20th anniversary of WRKY transcription
factor (TF) discovery. During the course of this time, the WRKY domain
structure, role in abiotic and biotic stress tolerance, phylogeny, and
regulation by various plant hormone pathways has been firmly
established. While WRKY TFs have been demonstrated to regulate plant
specialized metabolism, the family is far less renowned for this role.
Analysis of WRKY TFs regulating production of specialized metabolites
emphasizes the values of the family outside of traditionally accepted
roles in stress tolerance. Overall, the WRKY family promises to play an
essential role in regulation of important pharmaceutical, aromatherapy,
biofuel, and industrial components; thus, warranting considerable
attention in the forthcoming years.
